alert.note: Alert for Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 20 at 2:27AM MST until February 21 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 75 mph ongoing. * WHERE...Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range, The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks, The Northern Front Range Foothills, and The Southern Front Range Foothills. * WHEN...While there may be a few lulls in the wind, peak wind gusts are expected to reach 75 mph or more in wind prone areas. The strongest winds are expected to occur this morning, with perhaps a bigger lull in the winds late this afternoon and evening, followed by another blast of high winds late tonight and Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds may blow down trees and power lines. Isolated power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Watch for falling debris and tree limbs. Use caution if you must drive.
